summary.span: 作为所有 ASP.NET 移动 Web 窗体页面的基类。

span.span: Serves as the base class for all ASP.NET mobile Web Forms pages.

summary.span: 若要了解如何开发 ASP.NET 移动应用，请参阅 ASP.NET 移动应用和网站。

span.span: For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 类继承自 ASP.NET类。The class inherits from the ASP.NET class. 若要指定移动页并使用 ASP.NET 移动控件，ASP.NET 移动 Web 窗体页必须包含以下页指令。To specify a mobile page and use ASP.NET mobile controls, an ASP.NET mobile Web Forms page must contain the following page directive. ``` <%@ Page Inherits="System.Web.UI.MobileControls.MobilePage" Language="c#" %> ``` 需要 `Inherits` 属性。The `Inherits` attribute is required. `Language`如果需要将属性设置为在页上，使用的语言。The `Language` attribute is set to the language that is used on the page, if it is needed. > [!NOTE] > ASP.NET 移动页面允许多个移动的窗体在每个页上，而 ASP.NET Web 页允许为每页只有一个窗体。ASP.NET mobile pages allow for multiple mobile forms on each page, whereas ASP.NET Web pages allow for only one form per page.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当最初呈现页时，会自动成为 active 页中的第一个窗体。When a page is initially rendered, the first form in the page is automatically made active. 在后续回发，另一个窗体，可以进行处于活动状态，通过以编程方式设置此属性，或由于通过用户导航而控件。On subsequent postbacks, another form might be made active, either by programmatically setting this property, or as a result of user navigation through a control. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用属性控件。The following example demonstrates how to use the property of a control. 如果当前的移动设备允许控件的访问密钥，按钮将显示提交窗体的访问密钥。If the current mobile device allows for access keys for controls, the button will display the access key that submits the form. > [!NOTE] > 下面的代码示例使用单文件代码模型，并可能无法正常工作如果直接复制到代码隐藏文件。The following code sample uses the single-file code model and may not work correctly if copied directly into a code-behind file. 此代码示例必须复制到具有.aspx 扩展名的空白文本文件。This code sample must be copied into an empty text file that has an .aspx extension. 有关详细信息，请参阅[ASP.NET Web 窗体页代码模型](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/81b13e7a-b95b-4285-906f-d2dd77411417)。For more information, see [ASP.NET Web Forms Page Code Model](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/81b13e7a-b95b-4285-906f-d2dd77411417). remarks.format: ## Remarks 除了接口，ASP.NET 页框架提供`CustomAttributes`允许你指定的其他属性，可以启用或禁用自定义特性设置，或调整控件的行为或呈现的字典。In addition to the interface, the ASP.NET page framework provides a `CustomAttributes` dictionary that allows you to specify additional attributes, enable or disable custom attributing, or adjust a control's behavior or rendering. 若要启用或禁用自定义特性设置，您可以设置属性`true`，也可以设置`allowCustomAttributes`属性 <`mobileControls`> 到 Web.config 节`true`。To enable or disable custom attributing, you can either set the property to `true`, or you can set the `allowCustomAttributes` attribute of the <`mobileControls`> section of Web.config to `true`. > [!NOTE] > 启用自定义属性后，属性名称中的版式错误可以解释为自定义属性。When custom attributes are enabled, typographic errors in property names can be interpreted as custom attributes. 例如，如果开发人员错误地指定控件"的属性，分析器会将其保存为自定义人员"而不是引发异常。For example, if a developer incorrectly specifies the property of a control as "Txet", the parser would save it as a custom attribute called "Txet" instead of raising an exception. 因此，默认情况下自定义特性处于禁用状态。For this reason, custom attributes are disabled by default. ## Examples 下面的示例演示如何使用属性以使自定义`AccessKey`属性。The following example demonstrates how to use the property to enable the custom `AccessKey` attribute on the . > [!NOTE] > 下面的代码示例使用单文件代码模型，且如果将它复制直接到代码隐藏文件可能无法正常运行。The following code sample uses the single-file code model and may not work correctly if you copy it directly into a code-behind file. 必须将此代码示例复制到具有.aspx 扩展名的空白文本文件。You must copy this code sample into an empty text file that has an .aspx extension. 有关详细信息，请参阅[ASP.NET Web 窗体页代码模型](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/81b13e7a-b95b-4285-906f-d2dd77411417)。For more information, see [ASP.NET Web Forms Page Code Model](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/81b13e7a-b95b-4285-906f-d2dd77411417). remarks.format: ## Remarks ASP.NET 控件创建客户端脚本，以引发服务器上的回发事件。ASP.NET controls create client-side scripts to raise postback events on the server. 它是恶意用户可以回发的脚本用于将任意 post 事件发送到服务器控件。It is possible for a malicious user to use the postback script to send arbitrary post events to server controls. 为此，ASP.NET 版本 2.0 控件验证以确保由控件呈现的客户端代码引发事件的事件数据。For this reason, ASP.NET version 2.0 controls validate the event data to ensure that the event was raised by client-side code rendered by the control. 在移动页中不支持事件验证。Event validation is not supported in mobile pages.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果您希望从视图状态，还原页并且该页的基础会话已过期，此方法的默认实现将引发异常。If you expect to restore a page from a view state, and the page's underlying session has expired, this method's default implementation raises an exception. 你可以重写此方法，执行自定义处理程序来还原页状态而不依赖于视图状态，并返回而不会调用基实现。You can override this method, perform custom handling to restore the page state without relying on view state, and return without calling the base implementation.

value.span: 请求附带的查询字符串。

span.span: The query string that accompanied the request.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 该属性返回的请求，请按照在 URL 中问号 （？） 中的任何字符。The property returns any characters in the request that follow the question mark (?) in the URL. 此值可以不同于属性。This value can be different from the property. 对于唯一的文件路径后缀插入回发的 URL 的设备，此属性将自动消除文件路径后缀。For devices where a unique file path suffix is inserted into a URL for postback, this property automatically strips out the file path suffix. 例如，如果原始查询是"/ home.aspx?id=john+doe"，值属性将为"id = john + doe"。For example, if the original query is "/home.aspx?id=john+doe", the value of the property will be "id=john+doe". URL 可以是以下回发"/home.aspx?_ufps=20292303920 和 id = john + doe"。A following postback URL could be "/home.aspx?_ufps=20292303920&id=john+doe". 在此最后一个回发时，值属性都将再次"id = john + doe"，因为将剥除独特的后缀。On this last postback, the value of the property will again be "id=john+doe", because the unique suffix will be stripped out. > [!CAUTION] > 如果键/值对的键部分存储在属性等同于属性上的控件对象、 视图状态和键/值对会从属性。If the key portion of the key/value pair stored in the property is the same as the property of a control on the object, the view state and the key/value pair are removed from the property.
